data.title: Great place to meet with friends
data.text: The food us great! There is always some special day going on at Babes. Happy hour or 50 cent wings Monday.  The ribs are great plus free pop corn with your beer. Service is always great and a patio for the summer. One of my favorite places to go to.

data.title: Much better!
data.text: I didn't like this place in the past but since other restaurants have opened near them they have upped their game in a big way. The service is now great and the food delicious.

data.title: Happy Hour
data.text: Best around!!!!!  Great apps and fun atmosphere!.  Many options to choose from and everything we've had is good.  The pool tables are great for family fun.  They have bingo on Wednesday night and it's always fun!

data.title: Very good burger
data.text: My daughter went here and got a hamburger.  She came home saying "you've got to try their burgers, they are the best I've ever eaten".  She brought her 3 & 5 year old kids so it must be kid friendly

data.title: Wishing probably won't make it happen
data.text:
We've been here several times, and its South Suburban location is surprisingly descriptive, as it seems to going more "south" with each visit. Staff has better things to do than be attentive to customers, and the food is just OK.

We generally have frequented Babe's in the afternoon or early evening, and that has typically been a time when nobody in the place was overworked.  "Service" is slow and not always visible, and that is a problem when the servers often forget to deliver the entire order.  It's not easy -- not impossible, just not easy -- to get a burger that isn't cremated.  When things are prepared adequately, and when the right stuff gets to the table, Babe's is an enjoyable experience.  The location is convenient for us, and I'm OK with about one in three visits being very good, one in three fair, and one in three leaving me wonder if I shouldn't have gone to the other place down the street.

data.title: Good casual hometown dining
data.text:
I would call this a 'home bar'.  Good option if you live around the area.  The menu had the typical American food options.  It was good bar food, burgers, sandwiches, salads, & fried food. 

Sounds like they do live music on the most weekends.   They had a nice patio.  It was family friendly although I'm sure that cuts off after dinner when this place becomes more bar.

data.title: MBT Baseball Tournaments
data.text: While waiting for McDonalds to start serving their whole menu we had to stop at the bank and since we had a some time on our hands we thought we would head over to Babe's to get a beer.  The bartender was very friendly and served us right away.  When we asked her about a Moscow Mule she explained what it was and what her favorite flavors were too.  If you have never had one it is flavor vodka with ginger beer and lime juice served in a copper mug.  We had an original one and a blueberry one.  I really like the blueberry one.  Not sure how the food is, but I would go back to try it and have another Moscow Mule.

data.title: Horrible staff
data.text: The staff present was really bad and rude, I'll never ever recommend anybody to go there, when the staff isnt warm enough, I just doubt the food. Moreover, had friends traveling from different country and they were not allowed inside as these guys did not even recognize an international license.

data.title: It is what it is . . .
data.text:
We stopped by Babe's for the first time and sat on the patio.  The patio is on the street and got pretty noisy but it was nice to be outside.  They could perk up the outside dining area with a few plants or lights or something.  It is quite plain - probably because it would need to be hosed down after weekend partying.

My husband got BBQ Pork Ribs and he said they were wonderful. Perfect. Melt in your mouth. He also got Sweet Potato Fries which were limp and could have stayed in the fryer a bit longer.

I got the worst Margherita Flat Bread Pizza in the world.  Usually this is one item that is universally a pretty safe order but - - not at Babe's.  At least not at Babe's the day we were there.

Would we go back? Yep - - for those BBQ Pork Ribs!

data.title: Music was good but drinks overpriced
data.text: Went there for some drinks with friends, they had live music and a small cover fee which i don't mind. But a $7 crown and coke with mostly coke.... Seems a bit outrageous for a small town outta the city, unless they upped it for the live band.

data.title: Good times to be had at Babe's
data.text:
Babe's is in the old part of Lakeville. In the summer it has a outdoor dining/bar scene. Its a large place and can hold a lot of people outdoors and indoors. Weekends they have loud live music. They have awesome happy hour specials. The staff is friendly. There are a lot of regulars that come here. Stick to the basics- burgers, wings, beer. 
(Right now there is a Groupon so snatch that up)

data.title: Always good food and service
data.text: We've been going to Babe's for over 17 years.  Have never had a bad meal or poor service!  The wait staff is friendly, fast and helpful!  There are many recommendations from their menu - the ribs are great, any burger, margarita salad, club sandwich, french dip - it's all good.  Wednesday nights are busy with all-you-can-eat ribs and bingo but it's fun and worth the wait.  They added a patio a few years ago and that's really comfortable.  The atmosphere is casual and a great place to meet people.  Prices are very reasonable for food and drink.  Only downside is some needed updates on the floors and airing out the place but it is a sports bar so some stale beer smells are to be expected - maybe a few spills from me included - sorry!

data.title: Great service, Fun Atmosphere
data.text: Prices very reasonable, good entertainment and food was decent, would definitely recommend Babes for a fun date night out dancing..

data.title: Service good,food bad
data.text:
Burgers were way over cooked and was cold along with the french fries.

Service was good..nice atmosphere for sports events with big screen televisions

data.title: Neighborhood Place to See and Be Seen!
data.text: Babe's is the place where everyone goes and everyone knows your name. Been around almost as long as Lakeville and it's the place where you come back to, especially if you've been gone for awhile. Great place to meet friends for drinks, apps, and more. Music on a regular basis. Open mic to well-known local bands. Food is bar-brand, but good and the portions are large. Drinks are well-priced.

data.title: after shopping
data.text: Wanted a quick bite to eat after shopping downtown.  Standard food fare that you would expect at a sports bar.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: I have been here a few times...the staff is always very nice and the service is quick.  The food is delicious and they even have pull tabs :)

data.title: Ribs!
data.text: Several couples went to Babes for their Wed. Nite "all you can eat" ribs. The ribs were good, many sauces to chose from. The ribs are tasty; I personally liked the "sauce on the side".

data.title: Friday night Music Locale
data.text: Always great food here and plenty of space without a wait (usually).  They offer many specials like rib night and Friday fish fry.  Friday nights also bring live music.  There are restaurant tables seperated by the bar area which has pool tables and pop corn.

data.title: Nice!
data.text: It has a casual atmosphere, the staff are friendly, and great food (my favorite is the Black and Bleu Steak Salad).
